subject: RE: [junit] How to test a method without the return value by junit?
msgSnippet: There are probably many possibilities... I give you 2 ideas: 1) Use the method to test in a JUnit test method. If JUnit returns an error , you will be sure
messageBody:
There are probably many possibilities...
I give you 2 ideas:
1) Use the method to test in a JUnit test method. If JUnit returns an
"error", you will be sure that your method is bugged. (a test method without
any assertion is executed anyway and can show an error)
2) Use the setUp method to describe your envirronment and particularly the
objects concerned by the method you want to test. Verify with an assertion
that the method to be tested has done its work on the objects of the
environment
Hope this will help...

-----Message d'origine-----
De : chenhuitao@... [mailto:chenhuitao@...]
Envoye : Tuesday, October 09, 2001 11:34 AM
A : junit@yahoogroups.com
Objet : [junit] How to test a method without the return value by junit?


I am a newbie to junit.But now i have a job in my hand.I need to use
JUnit to test some existed java programme.Some methods of classes
have no return value.I can not change the source programme.How can I
test these programme by JUnit?
Thank you for your any help!
//BR ChenHuitao
